a television screen

3356.52.text:
or a movie screen,
but odds are,

3357.95.text:
it could be the computer screen
or maybe even that smart screen.

3361.72.text:
What a child grows up with,
they accept or they reject.

3363.63.text: It's what they grow up without

3364.86.text:
that becomes
profoundly important to them.

3366.46.text:
And what I learned
from Mr. Davis

3367.96.text:
is the importance
of going 18 inches,

3371.03.text:
the 18 inches between your nose
and their nose,

3373.30.text:
because that's where
the learning really takes place.

3375.81.text:
There is no computer
that can substitute

3378.74.text:
for the relationship between
an educator and a student,

3384.25.text:
because we are,
at the very core,

3387.92.text:
That's what I got
out of Brent Davies.

3389.85.text:
And the hardest presentation
I've ever give in my life,

3397.23.text:
'cause at age 57, he passed
just a little too soon.

3400.06.text:
And I wrote a poem
for Mr. Davies,

3401.93.text: and I'll share it with you.

3403.87.text: Before I do, let me tell you

3405.13.text:
how you can get in touch
with me.

3406.44.text:
If you're interested
in any of this stuff,

3408.04.text:
you can find me on Facebook,
just at revivingworkethic.com.

3411.31.text:
If you like the page
or you happen to like

3413.48.text:
the kind of articles
that I write--

3415.68.text:
and I try to always come up
with something interesting,

3418.35.text:
share two or three a month
on my blog--

3419.68.text:
you can click this little
graphic funky thing

3422.59.text:
if you have that QR reader
on your smartphone.

3425.86.text:
If you either "like"
my Facebook page

3427.42.text:
or subscribe to my blog
and send me an email--

3430.89.text: and this is the final part.

3432.06.text:
You got to say, "Hey, Eric,
I subscribed"

3435.47.text:
If you just send me an email,
I'm gonna send you back a link

3437.83.text:
that has that first video
we watched on it.

3440.17.text: It's got the ebooks on it.

3445.17.text:
But you have to do
one of the two.

3446.31.text:
You have to go
to revivingworkethic

3447.68.text:
or you have to like my blog
or both

3449.35.text:
and send me an email and say,
"I did it."

3452.65.text:
I will click
and send it your way.

3453.78.text:
If you have any suggestions
for me

3455.52.text:
improving this presentation,
please do that as well.

3457.99.text:
If you do any of that stuff,
I'm happy to help you.

3459.49.text:
I will finish with the poem
that I wrote for Brent Davies.

3462.06.text:
This was many years ago,
and sometimes I get

3463.69.text:
a little emotional
when I write it,

3464.86.text: but I think it means something

3466.00.text:
to people who chose to do
what we do.

3468.90.text:
"I could have chose
a glamour job

3471.47.text:
"I could have climbed
the corporate ladder

3474.40.text:
"I could be working
in a downtown lab

3476.91.text:
"or a fancy office
with city views

3479.71.text:
"or in a lab somewhere
where the world was awaiting

3488.58.text:
"I could have turned
and walked away,

3490.12.text:
"but instead I chose
to work with teens,

3492.92.text:
"for it's kids who seem
to need my help.

3494.76.text:
"A path, I'm called
to help them find,

3497.59.text:
"for they're the ones
who will decide our fate

3499.36.text:
"and right the wrongs
we've left behind.

3501.86.text:
"If success is measured
in bank accounts,

3503.57.text:
"then I'm a soul
by modest means.

3505.13.text:
"But if touching lives is what
it's truly all about,

3508.10.text:
then I'm glad I chose
to work with teens."

3512.41.text: thanks for having me here today.

3513.64.text:
I'll be outside
signing some of my books,

3519.42.text:
Thank you.
You guys are awesome.
